g.text: Incorrect code results in incorrect science
Code is science. Historically, the work of scientists has been reviewed by their peers to
validate it before being published. In modern times, computer code forms part of scientific
analysis, but it is rarely shared or reviewed.
This manifesto is for anyone who deals with code in a scientific setting, including publishers,
researchers, research software engineers, and administrators.
Department of Genetics, University of Cambridge,
for Interdisciplinary Research in Computational Algebra, University of St Andrews. Poster illustrations by
We agree that scientific code needs to be treated as a primary research output
